message.content:
Sure! Here is your tailored daily meal plan avoiding those specific ingredients. Remember to adjust portion sizes and snack times according to your personal needs and schedule. 

**Breakfast (7-8 AM): Avocado Toast with Tomato Slices - Gluten Free Bread, Ripe Avocado, Fresh Tomatoes, Olive oil & Salt (No dairy or nuts)  
* Drink: A glass of fresh orange juice. 
**Snack (10-11 AM): Carrot and Cucumber Sticks with Hummus - Chickpea based hummus without garlic **Lunch (12-1 PM): Grilled Salmon with Quinoa & Steamed Broccoli  
* Drink: Lemon infused water. 
**Snack (3-4 PM): Mixed Berries Bowl   
* Dinner Preparation Start Time: Get your ingredients ready for the following dinner at around 5 PM, so that you can relax during its preparation time and enjoy a stress-free dining experience when it's finally served.  
**Dinner (6-7 PM): Baked Chicken Breast with Roasted Vegetables - Zucchini & Bell Peppers   
* Drink: Herbal Tea, possibly Chamomile or Mint to aid digestion and relaxation before bedtime 
**Evening Snack (8-9 PM): A small bowl of seed mix without nuts **Late Evening Routine Time : Begin your night routine at around 10 PM. This could include some light reading, meditation or a warm bath to signal the body it's time for sleep  
* Drink: Chamomile Tea before bedtime can promote better sleep quality and help you fall asleep faster**Sweet Dream Time (Approx.:11-6 AM): Snooze till your desired wakeup call. 
Remember to drink plenty of water throughout the day, especially during meals for optimal digestion. This diet plan includes a good balance between proteins, carbs and healthy fats while avoiding dairy products along with specific nuts or ingredients you're sensitive towards like honey, almonds, pistachios and cashews. Always consult your doctor/nutritionist before starting any diet plan to ensure it suits your personal needs (like allergies etc.). Enjoy!
